dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 3437 IH: TANF Accountability and Integrity Improvement Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Noem introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To prevent States from counting certain expenditures as State spending to reduce TANF work requirements.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the TANF Accountability and Integrity Improvement Act.

section.header: No counting of third-party spending to meet State spending requirement

subsection.text: Section 409(a)(7)(B)(i) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 609(a)(7)(B)(i)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

item.text: for fiscal year 2018, the amount (if any) by which—

subitem.text: the value of all goods and services provided by a source other than the State or a local government during the fiscal year; exceeds
the value of all such goods and services claimed by the State as qualified State expenditures for fiscal year 2017;

item.text: for fiscal year 2019, the amount (if any) by which—

subitem.text: the value referred to in subclause (aa)(AA); exceeds
50 percent of the value referred to in subclause (aa)(BB); and

item.text: for any fiscal year after 2019, the value referred to in subclause (aa)(AA).

subsection.header: Exclusion of expenditures for the provision of medical services
subsection.text: Section 409(a)(7)(B)(i) of such Act (42 U.S.C. 609(a)(7)(B)(i)), as amended by subsection (a) of this section, is amended by adding at the end the following:

subclause.header: Exclusion of expenditures for the provision of medical services
subclause.text: Such term shall not include any amount expended for the provision of medical services.

section.text: The amendments made by this Act shall take effect on October 1, 2017.
